title: Langmuir-Blodgett films from organic solvents
authors: Alexander Sorokin, Larissa Maiorova, Maksim Zavalishin
abstract:
Surface layers of water miscible volatile organic solvents
(N,N-dimethylacetamide, acetone, ethanol, and tetrahydrofuran) have been formed
on water and their properties have been studied. The layers are stable on the
water surface and can be transferred to a solid substrate to form a multilayer
film. Despite the volatility of the source material, some films can even
withstand heating.
